answers.answer: I was induced at 38 weeks with my son because I had preeclampsia and my labor was 37 hrs. But that doesn't mean you will... You may be induced and only go 15 hrs... Every labor, delivery, birth  is different. :0) try not to stress you still have 3 weeks.

Is your question about being induced? Or is it about labor?I am a first time mom, I'm only 27w but I can imagine being induced is worse than going into labor on your own. They are forcing your cervix to open and contract. I pray to God I won't have to be induced. I want my lil princess to come when she is ready.
i would like to know too. im 37+2 and will be induced at 39 weeks due to my docs orders...my first borns labor was only 4 hours so im kinda nervous, i heard it slows the process:( BUMP

Both my labours were induced. Both by prostin (gel) but then with my daughter they had to break my water because it didn't bring on labour fast enough. My first labour lasted 21 hours and the second was over 24 hours but then resulted in an emergency c-section. Now in saying this I've had friends that were induced and their labours weren't as long as hard as mine. I personally think its just the luck of the draw.. My kids didn't want to come out. lol :)
Yea i guess its different for everyone. my friend was induced and was in labor for 26 hours and only pushing for 1 :/ I'm just scared hospitals make me nervous

Im with you about hospitals making ya nervous. My due date is tommrrow and so far no sign of my little guy. Been trying every trick there is minus the oils.. but im hoping that he will come before he has to be induced. I was hoping to stay home as long as I could before heading to the hospital so I wouldn't need to be there for hours upoun hours.. if I get induces that's going to be the case im afraid );

I heard first time pregnancies is common to go after your due date and i guess id rather him be too late than early but I'm so miserable. im gonna start doing all the "remedies" in the middle of 38th week. i dont thinj ill drink oil but.. I'm getting desperate haha

I have been induced with both of my babies and I was in labor each time for 6-8 hours and pushed for maybe 30 minutes. I don't think its necessarily more painful; all labor experiences are different and there's nothing to say you couldn't go into labor naturally and have it take 36 hours...
I've heard that too.. I don't mind going over my due date. Im not extremely uncomfortable or anything bad. I just don't want to be induced because he's not here before the 2 week late mark..

I was 0cms, no progression of my cervix at ALL at my 40 week appt, I was so depressed, my due date was here and NOTHING happened. I went into labor that night, was 3-4 by the next morning and had my son that night, it can happen really quick, so don't stress too much! I thought for sure I was getting induced, and didn't end up needing it!
Ah! THANK you for sharing that! Gives me hope (:
I wish someone would've told me that at 40 weeks, I cried ALL DAY LONG! Haha, I'm sure he'll come soon, boys tend to work on their own watch! ;)

Hahaha! I bet!  I'm sure ill be emotional come tommrrow and still no sign or baby. Maybe it was the crying that kick started it! Been doing my fair share of crying today not for prego reasons though. Husbands *sigh* lol

Ohh I know, husbands do NOTHING right when we're pregnant, haha! We went shopping the other day and my husband said, why don't you pick out some new clothes since you're getting really.....big.....hahah. I was like oh okay, taking the hint!!! Pretty soon your hormones will be back to normal and you'll be feeling good again!

Omg! Ouch! Luckily I joke about how big I've gotten that its not too touchy of a subject when it gets brought up. Though its sensitive deep down. And today it was because my sister wanted to go get pedicures on Friday if I don't have the baby by then. I haven't seen her in forever because husband isn't a fan of her. Anyways he didn't want me to do something without inviting him ( its a pedicure didn't think he'd be interested lol) plus just last week he went to his buddies house to do a fantasy football league! Idk if its because the baby could be here any minute but I feel so smothered with everyone lately!
I hope I'm lucky like you. i want to.go into labor naturally but not way after my due date. and i understand about the husbands. dont know how to he sensitive to us right now haha.

Wow now I'm freaked out! Lol I'm 29weeks and my dr told me she will induce me at 39weeks  due to my Hbp even tho it's control she wants to make sure everything is okay with me and the baby once I'm real close to my dude date! :( I hope It don't take more then a few hours for my baby girl to come out!

I agree, this is a time for YOU to relax and enjoy your alone time, you need to get out and do whatever it is you want to do before you have a baby 24/7! There's plenty of time for you and your husband, a few hours won't kill him, I'd go anyway!Alexlee, although many women go into labor late with their first, it's not guarenteed with everyone, I was "late" by one day, but a lot of first time moms don't need inducing either, you'll be amazed what 3 weeks will do!

question: Is it really as terrible as some women say? Like labor will last 30 hours and is just a long miserable process? I kno i still have 3 weeks to go but I'm not showing aany signs of labor or even contracting so i feel like he wants to stay in there
title: question about being induced
